attributes.action: make police use of images of deceased people illegal without prior consent from families
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Following the actions of Richard Brunstrom it should be illegal for any force to use images either photographic or video of any deceased person or persons without prior written consent from the deceased persons family . This would have effect on both private (closed to the public ) and public meetings . If it were to become a law it could possibly be called " Brunstroms law "

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/CommonSenseLaw/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
